questions.question: The main processing unit of a computer that executes instructions.
questions.explanation: The CPU is the brain of the computer that performs computations.

questions.question: Temporary memory that loses its contents when power is turned off.
questions.explanation: RAM provides fast temporary storage for active programs and data.

questions.question: The main circuit board that holds and connects all major components.
questions.explanation: The motherboard provides connectivity between all computer components.

questions.question: Software that manages computer hardware and software resources.
questions.explanation: The OS controls hardware and provides services to applications.

questions.question: A device that converts electrical power for computer components.
questions.explanation: The power supply converts AC power to DC for computer components.

questions.question: The process of starting up a computer and loading the operating system.
questions.explanation: Booting initializes hardware and loads the OS into memory.

questions.question: A storage device that uses rotating magnetic platters.
questions.explanation: Hard drives provide long-term storage using magnetic recording.

questions.question: Type of user interface that uses visual elements like windows and icons.
questions.explanation: GUI allows users to interact with computers visually.

questions.question: Device used to point and click on screen elements.
questions.explanation: A mouse is a pointing device for navigation and selection.

questions.question: Device that produces physical copies of digital documents.
questions.explanation: Printers create hard copies from digital files.
